newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU VETS EXTEND DUTCH PIG EXPORT BAN.
newsitem.headline: EU VETS EXTEND DUTCH PIG EXPORT BAN.

text.p: Veterinary experts on Wednesday voted to maintain the European Union's export ban on Dutch pigs because of swine fever for a further week, a European Commission official said.
The EU standing veterinary committee said the ban will be reviewed at their next meeting.
"The veterinary committee has ended its discussions and the ban remains in force for another week," the official said.
The export ban affecting all but a small area of the Netherlands was imposed last week after outbreaks of swine fever believed to have been caused by animals imported from Germany.
A 60-day export ban on pigs from four German states also remains in force.
The European Commission announced on Tuesday that it will pay 70 per cent of the cost of slaughtering pigs in both the Netherlands and Germany.
The veterinary committee heard that an inspection team which visited the Netherlands last week had reported that the country's swine fever controls were excellent.

"That was the word the report used although there was criticism that insufficient blood samples had been taken at the start of the epidemic," a Dutch diplomat told Reuters. -- Brussels Newsroom 32 2 287 6800
